movies.title: Moon Child
movies.plot: In the year 2014, Japan has collapsed economically and thus its people emigrated in large numbers and settled in other parts of the world. In a corner in Asia, there is a little street called Mallepa, a big melting pot where Asians such as Hongkongers, Taiwanese and Japanese live together. It was a place where people fought for order, food and freedom. It was there where Shou (Gackt), raised as an orphan and Kei (Hyde), who could live forever, met and became the best of friends. However, they were unable to escape from the fight for power involving gangs of different ethnicity on the street of Malepa...
movies.simplePlot: The story of love and friendship on the harsh streets of 2014 Mallepa, a small corner in Asia.

biography.bio: Hyde was the guitarist in another band when he was "recruited" by Tetsuya in 1991 to form the band L'Arc~en~Ciel. Since then, Hyde became the main lyricist of the band, although he also composes music for the band, and for his solo work. In his solo work, Hyde started with singles such as "evergreen", "angel's tale" and "shallow sleep" in 2001, and then he released his first solo album "roentgen". This album was released with lyrics in Japanese and another album with lyrics in English. After that, Hyde released "666", an album with more rock sounds rather than the mellow ones on "roentgen". In 2005 he re-initiated his solo career with the album "faith" and a tour that went even to the U.S. In 2008, Hyde in his solo work from L'Arc~en~Ciel, formed the band "VAMPS" with K.A.Z., releasing a collection of singles and two albums to this date, the band also went on tour in 6 countries, including for the first time a Latin American Country.
biography.name: Hyde

biography.bio: Gackt Camui, was born in Okinawa, Japan. His father was a music teacher, and his mother also a teacher. He is the second of three children, with an older sister and younger brother. His musical education began early, and he started learning classical music theory and piano from the age of three. After exposure to rock music during his teenage years he practiced electric guitar and drums intensely. In the early 1990s he was working as a sound technician and studio drummer, but by the mid-'90s he had begun his career as a singer. He spent a short time in the independent band Cains:Feel before moving on to the visual kei rock band Malice Mizer. With Gackt as vocalist, lyricist, and composer, they rose to fame within the visual kei genre. In 1999 he parted ways with the band and launched his solo career, debuting with the EP Mizérable. He has since released nine studio albums, eight compilation albums, and forty-four singles. He has toured extensively within Japan and also throughout Asia and Europe. With an illustrious career spanning over 15 years, and forty-three consecutive singles ranked in the top ten of the Oricon music charts, he holds the title of the most successful male soloist in Japanese music history. A hallmark of his productions has been the use of all-encompassing, conceptual, and sometimes abstract themes, "Moon" and "Requiem et Reminiscence", to develop a series of related songs, concerts, movies, books or theatre play. To describe this idea he combined the words visual, live (concert), and alive to form the term "Visualive". It references the evocative and immersive experience he strives to create for his audiences. In addition to his music career, Gackt has undertaken various film and television acting roles. He wrote and starred in his first cinematic production Moon Child (2003), which screened at the Cannes Film Festival in 2003, and the Philadelphia Film Festival in 2004. In 2007 he received a TV Navi award for best supporting actor in a drama, for his portrayal of the powerful feudal leader Kenshin Uesugi in NHK's The Trusted Confidant (2007). One of Gackt's most notable performances was as the samurai protagonist Yoshi in the Guy Moshe film Bunraku (2010), where he costarred alongside Josh Hartnett, Woody Harrelson, Ron Perlman and Demi Moore. His depiction of the unnerving eunuch Jo Teigai in NHK's TV drama Tempest (2011) was brought to movie screens the following year in Gekijouban Tenpesuto 3D (2012). Recently he reprised his role as both Takashi Shiki and Yumeoji (dream prince) from the television drama Akumu chan (2012) in the cinematic release, Akumu Chan the Movie (2014). Gackt's numerous voice acting credits include animated films, such as Dragon Age: Dawn of the Seeker (2012), and video games, with two from the popular Final Fantasy VII series; Dirge of Cerberus: Final Fantasy VII (2006)and Crisis Core: Final Fantasy VII (2007) among others. In his stage play debut Nemuri Kyoshiro Burahikae (2010), Gackt was cast as the leading character. He later expanded his theater credentials by resuming his "Moon" concept and writing, producing, composing and starring in Moon Saga - Yoshitsune Hiden (2012). He has since announced a sequel scheduled to begin in August 2014 entitled Moon Saga - Yoshitsune Hiden - Chapter 2 (2014).
biography.name: Gackt

biography.bio: Leehom Wang was born on May 17, 1976 in Rochester, New York, USA as Alexander Lee Hom Wang. He is an actor, known for Lust, Caution (2007), Blackhat (2015) and China Strike Force (2000). He has been married to Jinglei Lee since November 27, 2013. They have two children.
biography.name: Leehom Wang

biography.bio: Tarô Yamamoto was born on November 24, 1974 in Hyogo, Japan. He is an actor, known for Battle Royale (2000), Go (2001) and Moon Child (2003). He was previously married to Julie Warisaya.
biography.name: Tarô Yamamoto

biography.bio: Susumu Terajima is a famous Japanese actor who, as of February 2007, has appeared in 78 films, 15 television commercials, and three promotional videos. He is part of Office Kitano, the production company of actor/director/comedian Takeshi Kitano. Terajima was born in Tokyo, Japan, where he still resides. He made his acting debut in 1986's A-Homance, and has been steadily furthering his career ever since. Terajima is frequently cast in supporting roles, but has played the lead character in three films to date (Okaeri, Hole in the Sky, and The Blessing Bell). Terajima is best known for his portrayal of Yakuza figures, most notably in the films of co-worker and close friend Kitano.
biography.name: Susumu Terajima

biography.bio: Zeny Kwok was born on February 24, 1984 in Hong Kong. She is an actress, known for Moon Child (2003), Merry-Go-Round (2001) and Glass Tears (2001).
biography.name: Zeny Kwok

biography.bio: Seiji Chihara was born on January 25, 1970 in Kyoto, Japan. He is an actor, known for Moon Child (2003), Hana (2006) and Hanging Garden (2005).
biography.name: Seiji Chihara

biography.bio: Chihara Junia was born on March 30, 1974 in Kyoto, Japan as Koji Chihara. He is an actor, known for Odaiba seikeijuku (2012), Chihara Jr. no eiga seisaku iinkai (2009) and Kume pipo: Zettai aitai 1001 nin (2009).
biography.name: Chihara Junia

biography.bio: One of the original two dancers to join with Gackt upon his leaving Malice Mizer in 1999, Yosh has over the years earned the honored position of lead dancer and precious member of the Gackt family. A dancer who has mastered a wide variety of styles and skills, Yosh has assumed the position of being the man responsible for bringing new dance members into the fold and training them. Appearing in every concert and every tour alongside Gackt since 2000, he has become as noticeable and respected a part of the band as any of the musicians. Most of the complex routines seen in Gackt's live tours were choreographed by him, and he acts as Gackt's personal dance trainer and instructor. Known for his obsessive attitude towards achieving perfection, Yosh is nevertheless a beloved father figure to the other dancers who have worked with him in the hundreds of live shows he has performed. Never satisfied with simply doing the same thing over again, he has constantly pushed the envelope and expanded the routines, having thus far included frolicking cats, traditional Japanese dance elements, martial arts sequences, and break dancing technique. Many of these difficult performances take months to perfect, and through that lengthy process Yosh works and learns with the dance team, getting them to be at their best while he himself further refines his own abilities. Although other dancers have come and gone, Yosh is an ever-present entity within Gackt's organization and is well known to fans who have seen him live or witnessed his performances on DVD.
biography.name: Yosh

biography.bio: Kanata Hongô was born on November 15, 1990 in Miyagi, Japan. He is an actor, known for Gantz (2010), Attack on Titan: Part 1 (2015) and Hinokio: Inter Galactic Love (2005).
biography.name: Kanata Hongô

biography.bio: Ishibashi Ryo (Ryo Ishibashi) was born on July 20, 1956, in Fukuoka City, Kyushu, Japan. Being a multi-talented star, and an international celebrity, Ryo Ishibashi has starred in many TV programs, and movies both within his native Japan, and abroad. He began his celebrity career when he started his own rock band the ARB (Alexiander's Ragtime Band) in 1977, which made their recording debut on October 29, 1978. He released over a dozen records with the band until their breakup in 1990. Ryo Ishibashi started his acting career in 1986 when he became acquainted with the late actor Yûsaku Matsuda (who was also internationally known for his co-starring role with Michael Douglas in the movie Black Rain (1989)). He made his movie debut in Matsuda's movie "Ahomance" in which ARB's 13th single "After 45" was used as its theme song. Ryo Ishibashi has been concentrating on his acting career since his split with ARB in 1990, and has appeared in several movies outside his native country Japan, and became an internationally recognized celebrity.
biography.name: Ryo Ishibashi

biography.bio: You Kurosaki is known for his work on Gackt Live Tour 2005: Diabolos - Aien no Shi to Seiya no Namida (2006), Gackt Live Tour 2004: The Sixth Day and Seventh Night - Final (2004) and Gackt Live Tour 2000: Mars sora kara no houmonsha/Visitor from the Sky - La réminiscence (2000).
biography.name: You Kurosaki

biography.bio: Anne Suzuki was born on April 27, 1987 in Tokyo, Japan. She is an actress, known for Steamboy (2004), Snow Falling on Cedars (1999) and Returner (2002).
biography.name: Anne Suzuki

biography.placeOfBirth: New York City, New York, USA
biography.bio: James H. Thomas was born in the South Bronx, New York City, and educated in the United States, Beijing and Taiwan. He has spent over 15 years in Asia, including Beijing, Tokyo, Seoul, Hong Kong, and Taipei - homeland of Director Ang Lee. Besides his earlier career as a police officer in NYPD and athlete of the U.S. Olympic Track Team, he has worked as a free-lance director, teacher and actor in many Asian productions, including Chinese and Japanese movies. He is known as "Ji Ming" in China, and "Noriyaki" in Japan. With his multi-cultural background, James H. Thomas is fluent in English, Spanish, Chinese, and has basic Korean and Japanese comprehension.
biography.name: James H. Thomas

biography.bio: Etsushi Toyokawa was born on March 18, 1962 in Osaka, Japan. He is an actor and director, known for Love Letter (1995), Hula Girls (2006) and Face (2000).
biography.name: Etsushi Toyokawa
